Career

Janin's first work for DC was the 2011 JLA 80-Page Giant followed by the Flashpoint tie in, Deadman and the Flying Graysons. After the mini series, he was the artist selected for the DC New 52 relaunch ongoing the the Justice League Dark, where he has been of the few artist to remain on the same title since the beginning.

deck: Poet, master of erotic literature.
description:
Pierre LouÃ¿s was born in Belgium but spent most of his life in France. Among his friendships were Oscar Wilde and Andre Gide. He started very soon to show talent forÂ erotic verses and textes, marked by elegance and refinement of style. He was a passionate of Ancient Greece poems, a great source of inspiration for him. He was praised for the sensuality of his work, specially adressing lesbian sex. One of the first lesbian organizations was named after his book, "The Songs of Bilitis".Â 
Â 
His first novel, Aphrodite, was at the time the best-sellingÂ  work by any french author. It has been illustrated by Milo Manara, Georges Bess and Claire Wendling in a trilogy published by Humanoids Publishing. His work has been illustrated by most of the best artists on the erotic genre.
name: Pierre LouÃ¿s

deck: French comics writer and artist.
description:
Born in 1971, Richard Marazano studied physics and astrophysics before beginning his career as a writer.

His work has been published all over Europe as well as in China and the United States.

He has received the prize for the best scenario at the Angouleme Festival in 2004 and the prize for the best cartoon adapted for the cinema at the Cinema and Literature Festival in Monaco in 2006.
name: Richard Marazano

deck: Spanish artist co-founder of El Jueves magazine.
description:
He started his career in Vibraciones magazine, inspiredÂ by american underground comics. He has published strips in El Vibora, Rambla, Mata Ratos, Por Favor, Makoki and of course in El Jueves, where his most famous character, Martinez el Facha (Martinez the Fascist), has been included in every issue of the magazine since its foundation in 1977.Â 
Â 
He has received the Grand Prize at Barcelona's festival and the Gat Perich International award. In 2009, he publishes his first graphic novel, "El arte de volar", written by Antonio Altarriba.
name: Kim (Joaquim Aubert Puigarnau)

deck: Spanish artist co-founder of El Jueves magazine.
description: His most famous character is El Dios (God), published in El Jueves magazine since its beginning. He has been sued many times for offending the Catholic Church, although he has always been "absolved". He has also created Quico el progre, published in El Periodio de Catalunya and in JAuJA. In 1982 he acquires El Jueves magazine and creates, together with Gin and Oscar, the publisherÂ Ediciones El Jueves.
name: J.L. Martin (JosÃ© Luis MartÃ­n)

description: In the 70's,Â while there still was a dictatorship in Spain,Â he founds Barrabas and El Papus, two magazines that causes him various trialsÂ and threats by extreme right-wing organizations. Being the editor of El Jueves magazine he continues having some problems with censorship.

deck: Argentinian artist.
description:
She starts her careerÂ making cartoons in Argentina then she moves to Barcelona and meets writerÂ Andreu MartÃ­n. They get married andÂ start a long and prolific professional collaboration. At firstÂ they publish some comics for children then, in the second half of the 70's, they plunge into adult comics.Â They work mainly with magazines Troya and El Jueves, but also publish some worksÂ in magazines like Totem, Creepy, El VÃ­bora, Metropol, Zona 84 and Thriller.Â Adult publications flourished in Spain from the late 70's to the mid 80's, in what now is known as "the adult comicbook boom".Â Some of the series they create areÂ Bruc-2, Sam Balluga, Contactos and El titi. They also publish a one-shot called Python Trip.Â 
Â 
Without MartÃ­n, Mariel has collaborated in the collective book "Los derechos de la mujer" (Women rights) and publishes the longest running series of her career, Mamen, written by Manel BarcelÃ³.
name: Mariel Soria

deck: Spanish artist known for his political activism and his collaborations with Makoki and El Jueves magazines.
description:
He works for protest fanzines, labor union magazines and various socially and politically committed associations,Â besides El Jueves, Makoki and TMEO.
Â 
In his comics he condemnsÂ injustice, social apathy or corruption, and always does itÂ withÂ lucidity, forcefulness and humor.Â 
Â 
He is a member of various political organizations and founded a party, the PGB.
name: Carlos Azagra

deck: Spanish writer

deck: Spanish artist known for Makinavaja and Historias de la puta mili.
description: In the beginning of his career he works together with OscarÂ in magazines and newspapersÂ like Mata Ratos, En Patufet, Vida Deportiva, Mundo Diario or Diario de Barcelona. Together, they found Barrabas magazine. There is nothing like it at that time, and it inspires the two major magazines of the 70's: El Papus and El Jueves. He creates another magazine on his own that wasn't sucessful andÂ goes back to El Papus magazine. Months later, a fascist terrorist organization puts a bomb at the magazine's office. The doorman dies and there is 16 wounded. The magazine, that so far attacks fascism constantly, starts to go down hill. Most of the writers and artists move to El Jueves. IvÃ  moves to El Jueves as well, and creates his best known series: Makinavaja and Historias de la puta mili.Â He also publishes some stripsÂ in newspapers La Vanguardia and El Periodico de Catalunya.Â He dies ofÂ a car accident in 1993.
name: IvÃ

deck: Comic book artist and jazz pianist. He has worked for magazines like TBO and El Jueves and collaborated with many of the best writers in Spain (F. IbaÃ±ez, J. Escobar, V. Mora, A. Martin,...).
description:
Tha starts his career as a comicbook artist aged 15, with Patufatubadix and Els Ninots for Patufet magazine. He works as an inker for famous spanish authors like Francisco IbaÃ±ez, Jose Escobar,Â Roberto Segura and specially with Raf, for Editorial Bruguera. For TBO magazine heÂ draws Fort Baby and Ergo. He works as a group of four called QuatricomÃ­a, formed by him, his brotherÂ Joan Tharrats, Paco Mir and Sirvent. They publish together La Habichuela and Los Miercoles, Milagro.Â Â 
With his brother as a writer, he produces Ergo, Ciclo XXI and QuÃ© gente!. He also works with Andreu Martin, Victor MoraÂ and Jorge Zentner.Â 
Â 
As a musician, he forms in 1993 his own jazz trio, August Tharrats Trio.
name: Tha (August Tharrats)

deck: Spanish actor, director, writer, designer and producer best known for the humorous trio Tricicle.
description:
His most notorious work in comicbooks is the collaboration with Joan Tharrats, Sirvent and ThaÂ for El Jueves magazine. He has worked as a penciller as well for TBO and El Jueves.Â 
Â 
Apart from comicbooks, he is mainly a theatre actor, writer, director and producer, but he has also written and directed films and TV shows.
